metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7401 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cookie parsing code in Django before 1.8.15 and 1.9.x before 1.9.10, when used on a site with Google Analytics, allows remote attackers to bypass an intended CSRF protection mechanism by setting arbitrary cookies.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
python-django-common - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
python3-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-django package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.7-1ubuntu5.2').
